snippet: Ninety people, including doctors, pharmacy owners and elderly patients, were arrested this week in six cities and charged with submitting fake billings to Medicare worth nearly $260 million, federal officials said Tuesday.
abstract: Ninety people, including doctors, pharmacy owners and elderly patients, are arrested in six cities, mostly in Florida, and charged with submitting fake billings to Medicare worth nearly $260 million.
lead_paragraph: Ninety people, including doctors, pharmacy owners and elderly patients, were arrested this week in six cities and charged with submitting fake billings to Medicare worth nearly $260 million, federal officials said Tuesday.

headline.main: 90 Arrests Made, Mostly in Florida, in Crackdown on Medicare Fraud
headline.print_headline: 90 Arrests Made, Mostly in Florida, in Crackdown on Medicare Fraud
